clinical_study.brief_title: Body Perception and Complex Regional Pain Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Body Perception and Complex Regional Pain Syndrome : a Case-control Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
In CRPS, perturbation of body image and pseudo-neglect syndrome of the body part affected are frequently found. Pain and sensory perturbation seems to modify the way patients perceived their body part affected.
Does a local body image perturbation can affect the balanced of the global self-awareness?

detailed_description.textblock: With the investigation of spontaneous sensations (SPS) according to the protocol of Michael and al (2011) the investigators study how patients can listen to their internal sensations located in other body part than the painful member in order to construct a representation of the body and maintain it in active consciousness. A group of controls will be included to understand if there is a global modification in the perception of SPS witch may be linked to the pathology.

primary_outcome.description: areas of the hand where spontaneous sensations were felt

arm_group.description: Patients suffering from CRPS of the lower limb Patients with sensory testing in the two hand and neuropsychological evaluation
Healthy controls match by age, gender, Body Mass Index Healthy volunteers with sensory testing in the two hand and neuropsychological evaluation

intervention.intervention_name: Sensory testing in the two hand
intervention.description: spontaneous sensations while watching a hand

study_pop.textblock: Patients suffering from CRPS of the lower limb and Healthy controls

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For patients:
• a diagnosis of CRPS of the lower limb according to the Budapest Criteria (men or women) For patients and control group
- Age ≥ 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
For patients and control group
- neurological disease with cerebral repercussion or not stabilized serious physical illness;
- psychotropic medication
- disorders related to the use of a psychoactive substance (abuse, dependence or withdrawal);
- For patients:
- Presence of an other pain disorder
